causalinference.utils package¶

causalinference.utils.tools module¶

causalinference.utils.tools.add_line(width)¶
causalinference.utils.tools.add_row(entries, entry_types, col_spans, width)¶

Convert an array of string or numeric entries into a string with even formatting and spacing.

causalinference.utils.tools.convert_to_formatting(entry_types)¶
causalinference.utils.tools.gen_reg_entries(varname, coef, se)¶
causalinference.utils.tools.random_data(N=5000, K=3, unobservables=False, **kwargs)¶

Function that generates data according to one of two simple models that satisfies the Unconfoundedness assumption.

The covariates and error terms are generated according to
X ~ N(mu, Sigma), epsilon ~ N(0, Gamma).
The counterfactual outcomes are generated by
Y0 = X*beta + epsilon_0, Y1 = delta + X*(beta+theta) + epsilon_1,
Selection is done according to the following propensity score function:
P(D=1|X) = Lambda(X*beta),

where Lambda is the standard logistic CDF.

Returns:

Tuple (Y, D, X) or (Y, D, X, Y0, Y1), where

Y: N-dimensional array of observed outcomes D: N-dimensional array of treatment indicator,

with 1=treated, 0=control

X: N-by-K matrix of covariates Y0: N-dimensional array of non-treated outcomes Y1: N-dimensional array of treated outcomes
